ratioCalc
Class Ratio_Calculator

java.lang.Object
  ratioCalc.Ratio_Calculator
All Implemented Interfaces:
ij.plugin.PlugIn
public class Ratio_Calculator
extends java.lang.Object
implements ij.plugin.PlugIn

Calculates ratios between all pixels of two image stacks.

Version:
1.30a - 12-09-26
Author:
Till Andlauer (till@andlauer.net)

Field Summary
private  int bitdepth
          Bitdepth of the output image.
private static int centerValue
          Median rank, half of maxPossibleValue.
private  int defaultScale
          Scaling factor for histograms (for scaleOptions 0 & 3); set in chooseImages
scaling factor * (frequency / total amount of data)
default for scaleOption 3: 10000000
private static boolean displayLUT
          Show the LUT for the ratio image; set in chooseImages
private  int drawMax
          Height of histogram plots; set in chooseImages
(for scaleOption 3; max displayed frequency, not height in pixels)
default: 130000
private  boolean extraRatio
          Calculate ratio image separately to save memory; set in chooseImages
private  boolean histo
          Calculate histogram; set in chooseImages
private  int histoBins
          Number of histogram bins; set in chooseImages; default: 256
private  boolean image
          Generate an output image; set in chooseImages
private  boolean keepFiles
          Keep source files open; set in chooseImages
If false ImageJ might occasionally crash
private  boolean logInfo
          Show parameters in the log window; set in chooseImages
private  boolean logWindow
          Indicates whether data was added to the log window.
private  boolean mask
          Use mask for statistics, histogram & scatter plot; set in chooseImages
It is always recommended to use a mask
private  long maskCounter
          Counter for masked pixels.
private static int maxPossibleValue
          Maximum possible value (rank).
private  boolean maxScatter
          Scale scatter plot to the max value; set in chooseImages
Only relevant if the max frequency exceeds the max 32 bit value; otherwise higher values are cut off
Usually ok when false
private  java.lang.String memoryError
          Error message when out of memory
private  boolean normHisto
          Use values normalized by statistical frequency for histogram/statistics; set in chooseImages
private  double normValue
          Height of normalized histogram plots relative to other histograms
private  boolean oldFormat
          Generate statistics files in the old format; set in chooseImages
Option exists only for compatibility.
private  java.lang.String prefix
          Prefix added in front of image and table names; set in chooseImages
private  long satCounter
          Counter for saturated pixels.
private  java.lang.String saveDir
          Directory for saved files
private  java.lang.String saveError
          Error message when file couldn't be saved
private  boolean saveFiles
          Save all generated files; set in chooseImages
private  int scaleOption
          How to scale histograms; set in chooseImages
0 = Scale the max value of data & image to a fixed value (defaultScale)
1 = Don't change the data; for display only scale the max value to the height of the image window
2 = Don't change the data; scale the height of the image window to the max value of the data
3 = Normalize the data by the total amount of data points; specify the max value displayed in the plot (defaultScale, drawMax)
scaleOption 3 is recommended if several plots shall be compared
private  boolean scatter
          Calculate scatter plot; set in chooseImages
private  double scatterMulti
          Multiplication factor for scatter plot scaling; set in chooseImages
Only used if scatterScale=true
scatterMulti * defaultScale
default: 20
private  boolean scatterScale
          Scale scatter plot to total amount of data; set in chooseImages
true is recommended if several plots shall be compared
private  boolean showRanks
          Show the statistical ratio/rank distribution; set in chooseImages
private  boolean showUnbinned
          Show original, unbinned histogram data; set in chooseImages
private  boolean standHisto
          Use original values for histogram/statistics; set in chooseImages
private  boolean statistics
          Calculate statistics; set in chooseImages
private  boolean stripStats
          Calculate statistics without the (highest) value 255; set in chooseImages
Useful with potentially oversaturated data
private  int threshold
          Threshold for the mask.
private  java.lang.String title
          Title for dialogs and error messages.
private  boolean useUniRatio
          The use uniform ratio (a-b)/(a+b) instead of a/b; set in chooseImages
Usually unnecessary because ranks transform also the a/b ratio to a uniform distribution

 ij.measure.ResultsTable calcStats(double[][] ratioResults)
          Calculate statistics of the ratio data
The output table contains Minimum, Quartile 1, Median, Quartile 3, Maximum
First line: standard results // second line: combined results // third line: inverted results
Combined results:
Show the original value if 0<=value<=1, otherwise 1 + (1 - the inverted value); this way values are uniformly distributed around 1
Ratio Analysis uses the original values for statistics (standard results, line 1)

private java.lang.String memoryError

saveError

private java.lang.String saveError
Error message when file couldn't be saved

threshold

private int threshold
Threshold for the mask. Should be kept at 0 (-> all values above 0 are part of the mask).

satCounter

private long satCounter
Counter for saturated pixels. @see maskCounter

maskCounter

private long maskCounter
Counter for masked pixels. @see satCounter

maxPossibleValue

private static int maxPossibleValue
Maximum possible value (rank). (39641 for gapless data, 65536 for original 8-bit data)

See Also:
centerValue

centerValue

private static int centerValue
Median rank, half of maxPossibleValue. (19821 for gapless data, 32768 for original data)

See Also:
maxPossibleValue

logWindow

private boolean logWindow
Indicates whether data was added to the log window.

prefix

private java.lang.String prefix
Prefix added in front of image and table names; set in chooseImages

bitdepth

private int bitdepth
Bitdepth of the output image. 0 = 8 bit, 1 = 16 bit, 2 = 32 bit; set in chooseImages
Use 8 bit to save disk space, 16 bit for the original values

keepFiles

private boolean keepFiles
Keep source files open; set in chooseImages
If false ImageJ might occasionally crash

saveFiles

private boolean saveFiles
Save all generated files; set in chooseImages

scatterScale

private boolean scatterScale
Scale scatter plot to total amount of data; set in chooseImages
true is recommended if several plots shall be compared

private boolean showRanks
Show the statistical ratio/rank distribution; set in chooseImages

useUniRatio

private boolean useUniRatio
The use uniform ratio (a-b)/(a+b) instead of a/b; set in chooseImages
Usually unnecessary because ranks transform also the a/b ratio to a uniform distribution

oldFormat

private boolean oldFormat
Generate statistics files in the old format; set in chooseImages
Option exists only for compatibility. Should be false.

extraRatio

private boolean extraRatio
Calculate ratio image separately to save memory; set in chooseImages

logInfo

private boolean logInfo
Show parameters in the log window; set in chooseImages

private int histoBins
Number of histogram bins; set in chooseImages; default: 256

defaultScale

private int defaultScale
Scaling factor for histograms (for scaleOptions 0 & 3); set in chooseImages
scaling factor * (frequency / total amount of data)
default for scaleOption 3: 10000000

See Also:
scaleOption, drawMax

drawMax

private int drawMax
Height of histogram plots; set in chooseImages
(for scaleOption 3; max displayed frequency, not height in pixels)
default: 130000

See Also:
scaleOption, defaultScale, normValue

normValue

private double normValue
Height of normalized histogram plots relative to other histograms

See Also:
drawMax

scatterMulti

private double scatterMulti
Multiplication factor for scatter plot scaling; set in chooseImages
Only used if scatterScale=true
scatterMulti * defaultScale
default: 20

See Also:
scatterScale, defaultScale

scaleOption

private int scaleOption
How to scale histograms; set in chooseImages
0 = Scale the max value of data & image to a fixed value (defaultScale)
1 = Don't change the data; for display only scale the max value to the height of the image window
2 = Don't change the data; scale the height of the image window to the max value of the data
3 = Normalize the data by the total amount of data points; specify the max value displayed in the plot (defaultScale, drawMax)
scaleOption 3 is recommended if several plots shall be compared

See Also:
defaultScale, drawMax

Save a ResultsTable

calcStats

public ij.measure.ResultsTable calcStats(double[][] ratioResults)
Calculate statistics of the ratio data
The output table contains Minimum, Quartile 1, Median, Quartile 3, Maximum
First line: standard results // second line: combined results // third line: inverted results
Combined results:
Show the original value if 0<=value<=1, otherwise 1 + (1 - the inverted value); this way values are uniformly distributed around 1
Ratio Analysis uses the original values for statistics (standard results, line 1)

Parameters:
ratioResults - double[x][y] containing the ratio data; x: all ranks (39641 bins); y=0: histogram frequencies; y=1: ratio values
Returns:
ResultsTable with basic statistics (Minimum, Quartile 1, Median, Quartile 3, Maximum)
See Also:
getHalf, getMinMax, getMedian

getHalf

private static double[][] getHalf(double[] matrix)
Divides an array into two halves; the input already has to be sorted

Parameters:
matrix - double[] array
Returns:
double[x][y], x=0: lower half, x=1: upper half
See Also:
calcStats

getMinMax

private static double[] getMinMax(double[] matrix)
Calculates the min/max values of an array

Parameters:
matrix - double[] array
Returns:
double[x], x=0: minimum, x=1: maximum
See Also:
calcStats

getMedian

private static double getMedian(double[] matrix)
Calculates the median of an array; the input already has to be sorted
In case of ties the lower value is chosen

Parameters:
matrix - double[] array
Returns:
Median
See Also:
